content: Hey everyone! Could anyone please tell me a list of projects in Lean which are believed to be largest or most significant? I believe that should be a list of big theorems from mathematics, but I come from a CS background, so it is hard for me to tell.

there is also a list at the bottom of https://leanprover-community.github.io/index.html which appears to be more up to date (in particular all of the projects listed on lean_projects.html are/were in lean 3)

I am mostly looking into non-library type of projects. Like big mechanized theorems or a big certified system.

Michael Stoll said:

Does Mathlib count as a project?

Mario Carneiro said:

https://leanprover-community.github.io/lean_projects.html

this helps, thanks!
Vladimir Gladstein has marked this topic as resolved.

This could also help you: https://reservoir.lean-lang.org/, eg: https://reservoir.lean-lang.org/@AlexKontorovich/PrimeNumberTheoremAnd is not on the website Mario linked, and might count for your list?
This one is really interesting as an example of a project using material from fairly deep in Mathlib, and simultaneously being an "in production" industrial project. Cool!
They still find it necessary to extract to dafny. It would be very cool if we encode a dafny style language but with a better proof interface that lean already offers.
